member.name: T:Amazon.Shield.Model.ListAttacksRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ListAttacks operation. Returns all ongoing DDoS attacks or all DDoS attacks during a specified time period.

member.name: P:Amazon.Shield.Model.ListAttacksRequest.EndTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndTime.
The end of the time period for the attacks.

member.name: P:Amazon.Shield.Model.ListAttacksRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of AttackSummary objects to be returned. If this is left blank, the first 20 results will be returned.

member.name: P:Amazon.Shield.Model.ListAttacksRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The ListAttacksRequest.NextMarker value from a previous call to ListAttacksRequest. Pass null if this is the first call.

member.name: P:Amazon.Shield.Model.ListAttacksRequest.ResourceArns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceArns.
The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of the resource that was attacked. If this is left blank, all applicable resources for this account will be included.

member.name: P:Amazon.Shield.Model.ListAttacksRequest.StartTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartTime.
The time period for the attacks.

member.name: T:Amazon.Shield.Model.ListAttacksResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ListAttacks operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Shield.Model.ListAttacksResponse.AttackSummaries
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AttackSummaries.
The attack information for the specified time range.

member.name: P:Amazon.Shield.Model.ListAttacksResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The token returned by a previous call to indicate that there is more data available. If not null, more results are available. Pass this value for the NextMarker parameter in a subsequent call to ListAttacks to retrieve the next set of items.

member.name: T:Amazon.Shield.Model.ListProtectionsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ListProtections operation. Lists all Protection objects for the account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Shield.Model.ListProtectionsRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of Protection objects to be returned. If this is left blank the first 20 results will be returned.

member.name: P:Amazon.Shield.Model.ListProtectionsRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The ListProtectionsRequest.NextToken value from a previous call to ListProtections. Pass null if this is the first call.

member.name: T:Amazon.Shield.Model.ListProtectionsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ListProtections operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Shield.Model.ListProtectionsResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
If you specify a value for MaxResults and you have more Protections than the value of MaxResults, AWS Shield Advanced returns a NextToken value in the response that allows you to list another group of Protections. For the second and subsequent ListProtections requests, specify the value of NextToken from the previous response to get information about another batch of Protections.

member.name: P:Amazon.Shield.Model.ListProtectionsResponse.Protections
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Protections.
The array of enabled Protection objects.

member.name: T:Amazon.Shield.AmazonShieldClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing Shield
AWS Shield Advanced
This is the AWS Shield Advanced API Reference. This guide is for developers who need detailed information about the AWS Shield Advanced API actions, data types, and errors. For detailed information about AWS WAF and AWS Shield Advanced features and an overview of how to use the AWS WAF and AWS Shield Advanced APIs, see the AWS WAF and AWS Shield Developer Guide.

member.name: M:Amazon.Shield.AmazonShieldClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonShieldClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.Shield.AmazonShieldClient.CreateProtection(Amazon.Shield.Model.CreateProtectionRequest)
member.summary: Enables AWS Shield Advanced for a specific AWS resource. The resource can be an Amazon CloudFront distribution, Elastic Load Balancing load balancer, or an Amazon Route 53 hosted zone.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateProtection service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateProtection service method, as returned by Shield.
member.exception: Exception that indicates that a problem occurred with the service infrastructure. You can retry the request.
Exception that indicates that the operation would not cause any change to occur.
Exception that indicates that the resource is invalid. You might not have access to the resource, or the resource might not exist.
Exception that indicates that the operation would exceed a limit.
Exception that indicates that the protection state has been modified by another client. You can retry the request.
Exception indicating the specified resource already exists.

member.name: T:Amazon.Shield.IAmazonShield
member.summary:
Interface for accessing Shield
AWS Shield Advanced
This is the AWS Shield Advanced API Reference. This guide is for developers who need detailed information about the AWS Shield Advanced API actions, data types, and errors. For detailed information about AWS WAF and AWS Shield Advanced features and an overview of how to use the AWS WAF and AWS Shield Advanced APIs, see the AWS WAF and AWS Shield Developer Guide.
